Description: Spindle-whorl in a conical shape, made of limestone with a flat base and relatively shallow sides. Perforated in the middle with a diameter of 1.1cm, traces of the drill clearly visible. At the outer surface of the object many traces from cutting the surface into shape before polishing it. Several areas are heavily pitted and chipped off. At the outer surface one flattened area that was probably reused for grinding and a second area for usage as a hammer.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 133)
